19#if ! defined TIMESPEC_H
20# define TIMESPEC_H
21
22# include <sys/types.h>
23# if TIME_WITH_SYS_TIME
24# include <sys/time.h>
25# include <time.h>
26# else
27# if HAVE_SYS_TIME_H
28# include <sys/time.h>
29# else
30# include <time.h>
31# endif
32# endif
33
34# if ! HAVE_STRUCT_TIMESPEC
35/* Some systems don't define this struct, e.g., AIX 4.1, Ultrix 4.3. */
36struct timespec
37{
38 time_t tv_sec;
39 long tv_nsec;
40};
41# endif
42
43/* Return negative, zero, positive if A < B, A == B, A > B, respectively.
44 Assume the nanosecond components are in range, or close to it. */
45static inline int
46timespec_cmp (struct timespec a, struct timespec b)
47{
48 return (a.tv_sec < b.tv_sec ? -1
49 : a.tv_sec > b.tv_sec ? 1
50 : a.tv_nsec - b.tv_nsec);
51}
52
53# if ! HAVE_DECL_NANOSLEEP
54/* Don't specify a prototype here. Some systems (e.g., OSF) declare
55 nanosleep with a conflicting one (const-less first parameter). */
56int nanosleep ();
57# endif
58
59void gettime (struct timespec *);
60int settime (struct timespec const *);
61
62#endif
63
